intro: Camarotis philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests and is often found in mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
